Reviews.Title: Great camera for the coin
Reviews.Author: Shawn Waite
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the money.. good fit in between my DSLR and my point n shoot.  I picked up an adapter so my Canon lenses fit on this body.  Pleased overall, would like to see how the stabilizer lenses work with the video mode, the kit lens shoots some rough "action" video.

Reviews.Title: Dream Camera
Reviews.Author: Judi B
Reviews.Content: This Panasonic Lumix G-2 is a dream! It is light and easy to handle - even with additional lens attached. The very "skin" on the camera makes it easy to grip. It takes incredibly clear and beautiful pictures which viewers credit to me, but it really belongs to the camera as I am still learning. I have been a camera buff as long as I can remember and have always wanted one of this caliber. I did a lot of research before I made my purchase and I do give myself a pat on the back for choosing the G-2. I can't wait to get out and take more and more photos.

Reviews.Title: No English Manual
Reviews.Content: No complaint on the camera itself but It bothers me that it came with three operating manuals and none of them are in English. Called the company and they said it was not a mistake and that the english version was on the CD.  The only CD I got was a editing tool and had nothing to do with the operating the Camera.  Happy that I know a little bit about cameras or this would be a real pain. I am not going to down load over 100 pages off a website just to get what should have came with the camera.I give it three stars not to knock the camera but to show how ticked I am over there not being a printed manual in English with the package and the company telling me there isn't one. Shame on them for knowing this and thinking it is okay to run their business this way.

Reviews.Title: My favorite camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Grokett "bdfrogg"
Reviews.Content: I've had Nikon, Canon, and Pentax 35mm cameras. Then switched to those long zoom digital cameras, but found them too slow focus and shutter speed. I did like their smaller size over a DSLR, and when I found the 4/3rd's cameras, I immediately converted!  The Lumix has the professional feel and speed of a DSLR, but retains the smaller size to carry around. I did not want to lose the "thru-the-lense" eyepiece viewfinder, that many 4/3's cameras drop or require as extra, thus the Panasonic was exactly my fit.I've had mine for over a year now and gone on many world wide trips with it. If I had to replace it, I would instantly pick the Panasonic 4/3'rds DMC-G2 (or newer!)

Reviews.Title: My honest review
Reviews.Author: Neon
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product from you about a year ago and it was as described  and came with in reasonable time expected . I lost the lens cap the very first day would prefer it be an attached lens cap .That being said it has held up quite well.The camera takes awesome  detailed pics and amazing HD video .Pros .Sturdy ,attractive ,good size and weight, NO cheap partsTons of options  and the ability to change lensesCons: price of lenses MONO SOUND  and Panasonic supportquestion  does anyone have any suggestions as far as getting better sound quality  and a link for buying Accessories  for this camera other than Panasonic  which is so expensive ? thanks
